title: Analyzing Text Structure
learning_objectives: Understand how parts of a passage relate to the whole

content.title: Text Structure
content.subtitle: Relationships matter
points: Recognize how a paragraph/line functions in the whole passage
Identify signal words for cause/effect, contrast, addition

content.title: Common Pitfalls
content.explanation: Trap answers confuse contrast with cause/effect, or exaggerate function.
content.example: Sentence shows 'however' (contrast) ‚Üí trap says it gives an 'example'.

content.title: Structure Mastery
steps: Step 1: Identify signal words (while, but, therefore, for example).
Step 2: Ask how this piece supports or opposes the main idea.
Step 3: Predict role before looking at answers.
Step 4: Eliminate answers that misstate relationship.

content.title: Apply the Strategy
content.question: The function of the third paragraph is to:
choices: Contrast earlier claims with new evidence
content.explanation: Paragraph begins with 'However' and presents opposing evidence. Correct answer = contrast.

content.title: Text Structure Mastery
content.summary: Structure questions ask how a part fits the whole.
content.next_steps: Practice function questions in paired passages.
